text: Lionel Leo Hampton (April 20, 1908 â€“ August 31, 2002) was an American jazz vibraphonist, pianist, composer, philanthropist, percussionist, bandleader and actor. Hampton worked with Benny Goodman, Teddy Wilson and Buddy Rich to Charlie Parker and Quincy Jones. He was born in Louisville, Kentucky. In 1992, he was added into the Alabama Jazz Hall of Fame, and was awarded the National Medal of Arts in 1996. Hampton died from heart failure on August 31, 2002 in New York City at the age of 94. ==References== ==Other websites== * * Lionel Hampton at Drummersworld Category:1908 births Category:2002 deaths Category:Deaths from heart failure Category:American pianists Category:American composers Category:American philanthropists Category:American bandleaders Category:American jazz musicians Category:American movie actors Category:Actors from Louisville, Kentucky
title: Lionel Hampton
